Description: Funerary papyrus of Kerasher containing Book of Breathing made by Isis for her brother Osiris written in hieratic script; frame 1; full colour scene of the deceased being introduced before Osiris; right margin.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: See E.A.W. Budge, Book of the Dead. Facsimiles of the Papyri of Hunefer, Anhai, Kerasher and Netchemet (London 1899), pp.39-43 and pls. I-III. Herbin, F.-R., Books of Breathing and Related Texts (Catalogue of the Books of the Dead and Other Related Texts in the British Museum IV), London, 2008, pp. 37-38, pl. 15.
Bibliographic references: Quirke 1993 / Owners of funerary papyri in the British Museum (102)
Herbin 2008 / Books of Breathing and Related Texts (pp.37-45, pls.15-24)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (50324) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/50324)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2005-2008, California, The Bowers Museum, Death and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: bleached Black ink Pigment Backed: white Paper displayed in Room 62 until 1997 Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: good
